summary: KoA tumblr break
body:
KoA tumblr break

Since KoA is coming out in four days, a lot of spoilers will be spiralling on Tumblr. I don’t want to be spoiled this time, so I won’t be on Tumblr after it’s released until I finished the book. It may take a while, cause I will be away and won’t be able to read it immediately once it’s released.

summary:
Lysandra: It's okay little guy, you can tell me. Who could YOU be possibly afraid of?
Death: * points a shaking finger at Aelin...
body:

Death: * points a shaking finger at Aelin *

Aelin, flashing a grin: Boo.

summary: Caitsbooks’s Cover Change Corner - Throne of Glass by Sarah J. Maas The seventh and final Throne of Glass novel is coming out on...
caption:
Caitsbooks’s Cover Change Corner - Throne of Glass by Sarah J. Maas

The seventh and final Throne of Glass novel is coming out on Tuesday and I am so excited! I thought it was only fitting to go down memory lane and take a look at the original cover. Both the original cover and the redesign have Celaena front and center, but I personally prefer how the redesign looks. There’s also a beautiful collectors edition coming out that I absolutely adore and already preordered. (Read more of my thoughts on these covers here!)

Throne of Glass by Sarah J. Maas
US Hardcover (2012) vs US Hardcover & Paperback (2013)
US Collectors Edition (2018)

Do you like this cover change? Have you read this series? What cover changes do you want me to talk about next?

Check out all of my Throne of Glass reviews!

Book Review/talks! Writing! Photos!

“To the stars that listen”

tags: a court of thorns and roses
a court of mist and fury
a court of wings and ruin
summary:
Theories
How are these stories connected? Are they connected? 
I absolutely believe these stories are connected! There has been...
body:
Let’s Talk About This: Throne Of Glass Series and ACOTAR Series

Theories

  1. How are these stories connected? Are they connected?

I absolutely believe these stories are connected! There has been theories on how these stories are related. Let’s start with the facts. It’s Sara J. Maas first of all. Why wouldn’t she screw with our hearts like that? She has done some crazy, amazing, heart aching things to us. Now, why not Make Aelin take the keys, take all the power she has, and make a brand new world? There is a quote that I believe is in KOA.

Near the beginning of ACOTAR, Feyre explains that traditions and Gods have long been forgotten.

2. Aelin

Aelin once explained that she would create a perfect court. And she goes on to explain what kind of court she wants…what she dreams of.

3. Armen

Now there is two possibilities (if the stories are connected) I think that Armen is possibly Monan or Monan and Dorians daughter. Now for the first possiblity I believe this is true because she says that she is impossibly old. She also wasn’t always fae. She had to change herself to escape the prison. She also explains to the inner circle that “Armen” wasn’t always her name.

For the second possiblity I believe her to be the daughter if these two because Monan is most definitely not Fae she is a witch/valg. Also Armen has black hair unlike a witch who has white hair. But Dorian has black hair. Armen always was different. Now, I understand that when Armen had to change in the prison that her hair could have change to be better suit her new body. But when she was unmade in ACOWAR that she came out like a Phoenix. Is what I pictured. That doesn’t really sound like a witch ability. But that is something Raw magic could do which is what Dorian had. Was Monan possibly pregnant when she was taken into the new world?

4. Valg

All of us know that the witches are half valg. Or connected to them. So when Aelin (or whoever closes the gate on the valg and gods) well it bring all the witches as well and that’s how Armen/Monan/ maybe daughter ended up in a new world? Or did Aelin ask her to go and make sure the perfect court was made? Or is the Throne of Glass world destroyed by Aelin and she created Prythian? And Armen stayed alive to make the perfect court? Also what makes me to believe all the possibilities is that in ACOFAS Mor saw (more like felt) a darkness. And she described it as something evil and something powerful like a Valg prince. Now Sara J Maas could have added this little bit to miss lead us into believing it is the Bryaxis. When was possibly the Valg resurfacing.

What do you guys think? Let me know if you also have any theories or why u disagree with mine. But either way, we will get our answers When KOA comes out!!

My old username: Booklion12
I'm a bookworm who is also obsessed with music and loves to sing. I'm an obsessive fangirl: more specifically about Young Adult and New Adult books, but sometimes Taylor Swift, Teen Wolf, Marvel movies, etc. P.S. If anyone ever needs to get something off their chest or just needs to talk, I'm all ears :)

summary: October isn't Halloween, it's waiting for Kingdom of Ash
body:
October isn’t Halloween, it’s waiting for Kingdom of Ash

Ever since October started its been a weird blur of days of just like IT’S KINGDOM OF ASH MONTH and waiting till the 23rd…. Like we’re already a week away and it felt like those days passed in a blur but now time is moving extra slow

summary: Fall books: Ultimate romance reads, nonfiction and more
title: Fall books: Ultimate romance reads, nonfiction and more
excerpt: Fall is in full swing, and with it comes a new crop of great books to curl up with. BuzzFeed Books founding editor Isaac Fitzgerald, as well as New York Times best-selling authors Sarah J. Maas and Ann Patchett, join TODAY to round up their top picks, including “The Golden State” by Lydia Kiesling and “Barking to the Choir” by Gregory Boyle.

blog.name: thereyouareivebeenlookingforyou
blog.title: "You look good with wings," he said.

tags: ONE WEEK UNTIL KINGDOM OF ASH!
summary: SJM’s book recommendations on the Today Show 10/16!
title: SJM’s book recommendations on the Today Show 10/16!
body:
• Fiction: The Kiss Quotient by Helen Hoang
  • Nonfiction: The Husband Hunters by Anne de Courcy
  • Children’s: Can I Be Your Dog? by Troy Cummings

“The final book in my Throne of Glass series is coming out a week from today, and it’s really surreal. I began writing this series when I was 16 years old, and I’m 32 now, so I’ve worked on it for literally half of my life. So it’s going to be really insane to go out there next week and know it’s done.” - Sarah J. Maas

reblog.comment:

summary: Is anyone else...
body:
Is anyone else…

Having trouble getting through the Throne of Glass series again because you know that once you finish the books and once Kingdom of Ash comes out, it’s truly the end of the road for Aelin and everyone we’ve come to love?

Anyone else scared of what KoA has in store for us?

blog.description: This blog is dedicated to sharing the best quotes and passages from YA & NA literature. Submissions and suggestions always welcome <3

tags: a court of thorns and roses
summary: I was as unburdened as a piece of dandelion fluff, and he was the wind that stirred me about the world.
text: I was as unburdened as a piece of dandelion fluff, and he was the wind that stirred me about the world.
source: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Thorns and Roses

reblog.comment: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Thorns and Roses

blog.name: books-and-cookies
blog.title: Books are friends, not food
blog.description:
Mary, 30, a lady who has a cottage in a forest and who may or may not be a witch and have the answers to life and everything (lol no, my motto is fake it till you make it). I have loved books ever since I was a little girl. If I could spend my whole day reading, I would. Life unfortunately gets in the way. It's rude, really.

2019 Reading Challenge

Mary has read 3 books toward her goal of 55 books.

tags: i WILL end you if you spoil this book for me
summary: GUYS We’re just 12 days away from the release of Kingdom of Ash, so I just wanted to remind you to PLEASE, for the love of all...
body:
GUYS

We’re just 12 days away from the release of Kingdom of Ash, so I just wanted to remind you to PLEASE, for the love of all that is holy and pure in this gods forsaken world, don’t post any spoilers for at least a month after publication date. A lot of us don’t have access to physical bookstores that will carry the book on release day, and online orders sometimes take a few weeks to arrive. 

So please, PLEASE, at least tag your spoilers for at least one month after publication date. Please allow everyone to experience this book without anyone ruining that. 

Thank you <3

summary: Aelin, with a lush bag: Listen I know we don’t get along with each other but I got you a bath bomb for your birthday. So...
body:
Aelin, with a lush bag: Listen I know we don’t get along with each other but I got you a bath bomb for your birthday. So whenever you’re feeling stressed and need a bath, just fill your bathtub with water and drop this in. I guarantee all your worries will be over.

Lorcan, opening the bag: this is a toaster.

reblog.comment:
